newsitem.title: UK: Barclays staff set for strike ballot-union.
newsitem.headline: Barclays staff set for strike ballot-union.

text.p: Staff at Barclays Bank look set to vote in favour of holding a strike ballot as unions claim the bank is proposing to freeze pay and pensions of many staff, the UNiFI union said on Tuesday.
UNiFI said although its ballot does not close until Friday, "feedback from staff indicates a resounding 'yes' for a strike action vote."
UNiFI has 46,000 members and represents around two-thirds of Barclays staff while another union BIFU has several thousand members at the bank.

Barclays said it plans to phase in a new salaries scheme which would introduce pay rises completely based on individual staff performance. It also plans to abolish a 2.5 percent guaranteed Christmas bonus and replace it with a performance related one of between 2.5 and eight percent.
UNiFI said the effect of the move would be for the vast majority of staff to have their pay frozen for the foreseeable future.

A Barclays spokeswoman challenged this claim but conceded that staff whose pay was at the top of a particular salary band would not get a pay rise regardless of whether they exceeded their agreed performance plan.
But the spokeswoman said that over time, the salary bands would move allowing staff headroom to receive a performance-related increase.
